name: Product of two powers m·xᵃ·yᵇ (elementwise multiplication)
description: Returns product of powers m⋅xayb (multiplied by m parameter). Second argument y is optional: if it is skipped, performs single power operation m⋅xa.

controls.name: b
controls.description: Note: here and in the previous parameter you can use either a usual real number, or a special string "A / B", where A and B are any real numbers (spaces are ignored). The last form means usual division A/B. It can be convenient, for example, for values like 1/3, that cannot be written exactly as a decimal numbers.

controls.caption: Fill alpha
controls.name: fillAlphaWithMaxValue
controls.description:
This flag is important when the number of channels in image "y" is less than the number of channels in image "x".
If the flag is set, and the number of "x" channels ≥4 and is greater than the number of "y" channels, then the 4th "y" channel (alpha) and all subsequent "extra" channels will be supposed to be filled with the maximal possible value. For the alpha-channel, this means "full opacity".
If the flag is not set, all "extra" "y" channels will be supposed to be copies of the first "y" channel.
